sn46.32:4.1: “Mendicants, whatever qualities are wholesome, part of the wholesome, on the side of the wholesome, all of them are rooted in rational focus and meet at rational focus,
sn46.32:4.2: and rational focus is said to be the best of them.
sn46.32:4.3: A mendicant accomplished in rational focus can expect to
sn46.32:4.4: develop and cultivate the seven awakening factors.
sn46.32:5.1: And how does a mendicant with rational focus develop and cultivate the seven awakening factors?
sn46.32:5.2: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening-factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, samādhi, and
sn46.32:5.3: equanimity, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.
sn46.32:5.4: That’s how a mendicant with rational focus develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors.”
